channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Talk to parents about jab, top doctor tells 12 to 15-year-olds
item.description: Jab recommended for 12 to 15-year-olds but decision up to children and parents, Frank Atherton says.

item.title: Barry attempted murder: Man admits stabbing lottery-winner partner
item.description: Emma Brown, 49, is known for donating to local causes after winning £5.5m in 2017.

item.title: Former swimming coach jailed for sex assaults on children
item.description: Tom Piggot, 21, was convicted of a total of 10 offences, all of which he had denied.

item.title: TikTok star and Wales' oldest woman dies at 110
item.description: Amy Winifred Hawkins became a TikTok hit when a video of her singing was seen over 150,000 times.

item.title: Caernarfon diving death: Body of man, 64, recovered
item.description: The man was part of a group and did not resurface at the same time as the other divers, police say.

item.title: Former Gwent Police officer charged with misconduct in public office
item.description: Paul Chadwick, 51, is alleged to have had two inappropriate relationships while a serving officer.

item.title: Climate change: Hydrogen to create jobs - but is it green enough?
item.description: Hydrogen is expected to be crucial for energy and jobs, but not everyone agrees on how green it is.

item.title: Periods: Festivals need facilities at live events, says singer
item.description: Having a period at festivals can be dehumanising due to a lack of facilities, festival-goers say.

item.title: Covid vaccine passports in Wales: Are you for or against?
item.description: As Scotland introduces vaccine passports and England scraps its plans, what should Wales do?

item.title: Penarth water loss reported after pipe bursts overnight
item.description: Some residents are without water or experiencing low pressure, Welsh Water says.

item.title: First Cymru bus driver shortage sees 15 routes suspended
item.description: First Cymru says it was unable to operate some routes in Swansea and Neath Port Talbot on Monday.

item.title: 'No answers' decade after Glyn Summers' Spanish fall death
item.description: Glyn Summers, 17, was on an educational trip to Spain when he fell from a hotel balcony.

item.title: Festivals: Period facilities are needed at live events
item.description: Menstruating at lives event can be "dehumanising and daunting", festival-goers say.

item.title: Stereophonics: Cardiff gig resale ticket prices 'annoying' for band
item.description: The Welsh rockers urge fans to avoid secondary resale sites for their Christmas shows in Cardiff.

item.title: Afghan refugees 'leave everything behind and have nothing'
item.description: Wales' Afghan community have been collecting clothes, shoes, toys and nappies for children.

item.title: Covid in Wales: No vaccine passports needed for public services
item.description: The Welsh government is considering whether vaccine passports should be introduced in some settings.

item.title: Endometriosis: 'I thought I would die from period blood loss'
item.description: Anna Cooper was told was nothing wrong but has now had 13 surgeries due to endometriosis.

item.title: Pontypridd market street food Michelin-star chefs for food gong
item.description: Janet Wei beat some chefs who worked in Michelin-star restaurants to claim the title.

item.title: Rubin Colwill: Cardiff City and Wales youngster's rise to prominence is gathering pace
item.description: A match-winning double at Nottingham Forest was the latest landmark day for Cardiff City teenager Rubin Colwill.

item.title: Former Wales women players say 'enough is enough' and demand action from WRU
item.description: Former players launch a petition calling for the Welsh Rugby Union to bring back elite performance pathways for girls.

item.title: Owain Williams: Former Wales back-row forward Williams dies aged 56
item.description: Owain Williams' death follows that of elder brother and former Wales and Lions back-row forward Gareth in 2018.

item.title: Ben Hamer: Goalkeeper 'learning again' as he aims to seize Swansea City chance
item.description: Ben Hamer says he is "learning again" under Russell Martin after being handed a chance to claim the goalkeeper shirt at Swansea City.

item.title: Hannah Cain: Injury robs Leicester forward of first Wales chance
item.description: Leicester City forward Hannah Cain withdraws injured after receiving her first Wales call-up for World Cup qualifiers.

item.title: Swyddogion meddygol o blaid brechu plant 12-15 oed
item.description: Ar ôl derbyn cyngor gan y Cyd-bwyllgor Imiwneiddio a Brechu, mae pedair gwlad y DU yn dweud y dylid brechu plant.

item.title: Carcharu cyn-hyfforddwr nofio am ymosodiadau rhyw ar blant
item.description: Mae Tom Piggot wedi'i ddedfrydu i naw mlynedd o garchar am ymosodiadau rhyw ar dri o blant.

item.title: Y cyn-flaenwr Owain Williams wedi marw yn 56 oed
item.description: Mae teyrngedau wedi eu rhoi i "un o'r blaenwyr rheng-ôl gorau y cafodd Caerdydd erioed".

item.title: 'Da chi byth yn rhy hen i drio rhywbeth newydd!'
item.description: Rhian Cadwaladr a'i her i gyrraedd 60 copa cyn troi'n 60

item.title: Batwyr Sir Gaerloyw yn creu argraff yng Nghaerdydd
item.description: Chris Dent a Graeme van Buuren gafodd y gorau o'r ail ddiwrnod yn erbyn Morgannwg ddydd Llun.
